metadata.title: CVE-2023-0767 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
An attacker could construct a PKCS 12 cert bundle in such a way that could allow for arbitrary memory writes via PKCS 12 Safe Bag attributes being mishandled. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 110, Thunderbird < 102.8, and Firefox ESR < 102.8.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-0767` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss3 - 2:3.82-1ubuntu0.1
libnss3-tools - 2:3.82-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: mozjs78 package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
nss package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:3.82-1ubuntu0.1').
thunderbird package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1').
